definition:
The [*opposite number*]{} of a number $a$ is such a number $-a$ that
$$-a\!+\!a \;=\; 0.$$

Some properties:

-   $-a \;=\; (-1)\!\cdot\!a$

-   $-0 \;=\; 0$

-   $-(-a) \;=\; a$

-   $-(a\!+\!b) \;=\; (-a)\!+\!(-b)$

-   $-(a\!\cdot\!b) \;=\; a\!\cdot\!(-b) \;=\; (-a)\!\cdot\!b$

-   $-(a\!-\!b) \;=\; b\!-\!a$

-   $-\sum_{j = 1}^n a_j \;=\; \sum_{j = 1}^n (-a_j)$

-   $-\int_a^b f(x)\,dx \;=\; \int_b^a f(x)\,dx$

Exactly similar properties (except the last) are valid in every ring.
The fifth property implies the

**Corollary.** If one changes the sign of one factor of a ring product,
then the sign of the whole product changes.
